verses.text: The word of the \sc Lord\sc* that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Behold, waters rise up out of the north, And shall be an overflowing flood, And shall overflow the land, and all that is therein; The city, and them that dwell therein: Then the men shall cry, And all the inhabitants of the land shall howl.

At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong \add horses\add*, At the rushing of his chariots, \add And at\add* the rumbling of his wheels, The fathers shall not look back to \add their\add* children For feebleness of hands;

Because of the day that cometh to spoil all the Philistines, \add And\add* to cut off from Tyrus and Zidon every helper that remaineth: For the \sc Lord\sc* \add will\add* spoil the Philistines, The remnant of the country of Caphtor.
Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is cut off \add with\add* the remnant of their valley: How long wilt thou cut thyself?
O thou sword of the \sc Lord\sc*, how long \add will it be\add* ere thou be quiet? Put up thyself into thy scabbard, rest, and be still.
How can it be quiet, seeing the \sc Lord\sc* hath given it a charge Against Ashkelon, and against the sea shore? there hath he appointed it.
